sinks.name: TEE_CreatePersistentObject
sinks.reason: Size parameter could be manipulated to cause buffer overflows or memory corruption issues.

sinks.name: TEE_CreatePersistentObject
sinks.reason: If the attributes parameter is tainted, it could lead to improper object creation or access control issues.

sinks.name: TEE_Free
sinks.reason: Tainted pointer could lead to freeing invalid or already freed memory, causing memory corruption or double free vulnerabilities.

sinks.name: TEE_GetObjectInfo1
sinks.reason: Tainted object ID could lead to unauthorized access to sensitive object information.

sinks.name: TEE_Malloc
sinks.reason: Accepts size parameter that could be tainted, leading to buffer overflows or memory corruption.

sinks.name: TEE_MemMove
sinks.reason: Destination could be shared with Normal World, leading to potential data exposure.

sinks.name: TEE_MemMove
sinks.reason: Size parameter could be manipulated, leading to buffer overflow or memory corruption.

sinks.name: TEE_ReadObjectData
sinks.reason: Writes data to a buffer that could be shared with the Normal World

sinks.name: TEE_ReadObjectData
sinks.reason: Size parameter could be manipulated, leading to buffer overflow

sinks.name: TEE_WriteObjectData
sinks.reason: Potential exposure of tainted data to Normal World if the object is shared

sinks.name: TEE_WriteObjectData
sinks.reason: Manipulated size parameter could lead to buffer overflow
